title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-3.4 - Licensing examinations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-3.4 - Licensing examinations

State Regulations
(a) A
candidate shall pass two separate examinations, satisfactory to the board, prior to certification. (b) One
examination shall test, but shall not be limited to testing, the applicant's
knowledge of interior design theory, building and interior systems, planning, contract documents, and professional practice. (c) The other examination shall test the
applicant's knowledge relative to fire, safety, and building codes. (d) Education requirements for admission. Notwithstanding the provisions of section
59.2
of this Title, an applicant
for certification shall not be required to satisfy all education requirements
before being admitted to a professional licensing examination in interior
design. Such education requirements shall be completed prior to
certification. (e) Grade retention. The grade retention limitations of section
59.5
(f) of this

Title shall not be applicable to a professional licensing examination in
interior design. (f) Passing
standard. The passing standard for each examination shall be determined by the
board. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
79-3.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
